thread.title: Prankster Roman Atwood tricks girlfriend by 'blowing up son' in cruel prank
thread.title_full: Prankster Roman Atwood tricks girlfriend by 'blowing up son' in cruel prank

author: canberratimes.com.au
title: Prankster Roman Atwood tricks girlfriend by 'blowing up son' in cruel prank
text:
Click to play video Return to video Video settings Please Log in to update your video settings

Prankster 'blows up' son US comedian and Youtube prankster Roman Atwood terrifies his girlfriend when she believes their son is involved in an explosive quad bike accident. 
PT1M12S http://www.canberratimes.com.au/action/externalEmbeddedPlayer?id=d-44f4u 620 349 October 13, 2015 - 11:51AM Autoplay On Off Video feedback Video settings Imagine seeing your toddler drive off on a quad bike and crash in a giant explosion.
That's exactly what US comedian and YouTube prankster Roman Atwood did with his latest trick.
Atwood enlists the help of his three-year-old son, Kane, by sitting him on a quad bike and pretending they are going for a ride.
This massive explosion was just part of the prank. Photo: YouTube/Roman Atwood 
When his girlfriend Brittney isn't looking, he tells Kane to hop off and hide in the car. He then puts a dummy on the bike.
Advertisement The vehicle is actually remote-controlled, and Atwood drives it up a ramp and into a ditch - where there is a giant explosion.
Brittney runs squealing after the bike, but when she gets to the ditch and realises it's a prank, she is not impressed.
"That is not funny."
He replies, "It's kinda funny," to which he receives a kick from his partner.
Their son comes running out of hiding and into the arms of his very relieved mother. 
The video, posted on YouTube, has already had more than 3.1 million views.
Stuff
